intro: Hemigenia rigida, commonly known as the rigid hemigenia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its square, hairy stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Hemigenia rigida is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
